item.title: ‘End-to-end encrypted’ smart toilet camera is not actually end-to-end encrypted
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Kohler, the makers of a smart toilet camera, can access customers' data stored on its servers, and can use customers’ bowl pictures to train AI.

item.title: Company backed by Donald Trump Jr.’s firm nabs $620M government contract
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Vulcan Elements, a rare earths startup has secured a $620 million contract from the U.S .defense department.

item.title: Tonight, the future of deep tech will be explained to you at StrictlyVC Palo Alto
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: On Wednesday evening at Playground Global in Palo Alto, some very smart people who are building things you don't understand yet will explain what's coming. This is the final StrictlyVC event of 2025, and truly, the lineup is ridiculous.

item.title: Fintech firm Marquis alerts dozens of US banks and credit unions of a data breach after ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Marquis said ransomware hackers stole reams of banking customer data, containing personal information and financial records, as well as Social Security numbers, belonging to hundreds of thousands of people. The number of affected people is expected to rise.

item.title: Energy department hands out $800M in grants for small nuclear reactors
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The Tennessee Valley Authority and Holtec were awarded substantial grants to build one reactor in Tennessee and two more in Michigan.

item.title: Anthropic hires lawyers as it preps for IPO
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Anthropic is reportedly prepping for an IPO that could come as early as 2026.

item.title: AWS doubles down on custom LLMs with features meant to simplify model creation
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: AWS is launching more capabilities in both Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker AI to make building custom models easier.

item.title: What is Bending Spoons? Everything to know about Eventbrite’s acquirer
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Bending Spoons remains largely unknown, even as its portfolio of products has served more than a billion people.

item.title: Another bid to block state AI regulation has failed… for now
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Republicans’ attempt to ban state AI regulations was removed from the defense bill after bipartisan opposition, underscoring tensions between tech-industry demands, consumer protection concerns, and Trump’s push for sweeping federal preemption.

item.title: Google Photos’ 2025 Recap turns to Gemini to find your highlights
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The Google Photos Recap will use Gemini's AI to find your memorable moments throughout the year, and adds new metrics, like a 'selfie' count.

item.title: Amazon Fire TV’s new AI feature lets you jump to scenes by describing them to Alexa+
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Amazon says you can describe the scene to Alexa by mentioning details like the actor or character's name, or a memorable quote.

item.title: Autolane is building ‘air traffic control’ for autonomous vehicles
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: And the Palo Alto-based startup has raised $7.4 million to do that.

item.title: Waymo starts autonomous testing in Philadelphia
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Baltimore, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, and St. Louis join a long list of cities where the company is gearing up to offer robotaxi rides.

item.title: Spotify Wrapped 2025 adds its first multiplayer feature with ‘Wrapped Party’
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Spotify Wrapped returns to its data-driven roots with new interactive features, deeper insights, and social experiences designed to revive its fan-favorite feel.

item.title: Nothing looks to its community to raise $5M, wants to be ‘IPO-ready’ in 3 years
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The new round, which opens on December 10, will enable consumers to buy the company's shares at its Series C valuation of $1.3 billion.

item.title: After intense backlash, India pulls mandate to preinstall government app on smartphones
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: On Wednesday, the Indian telecom ministry said Sanchar Saathi, an anti-theft and cybersecurity protection app, would remain voluntary and that smartphone makers would no longer be required to preload it on devices they sell.

item.title: Uber and Avride launch robotaxi service in Dallas
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The service comes with a few caveats, including the addition of a human safety operator behind the wheel and a limited operating area. The companies said fully driverless operations, without a safety operator, will begin in the future and the service area will expand.

item.title: Healthify upgrades its AI assistant Ria with real-time conversation capabilities
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Khosla-backed health startup Healthify on Tuesday launched a new version of its health assistant Ria, which you can converse with live, via voice, and by using the camera for getting input about your food.

item.title: All the biggest news from AWS’ big tech show re:Invent 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak, Julie Bort, Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Amazon Web Services giant tech conference is happening this week with news ranging from chips to AI services.

item.title: Amazon challenges competitors with on-premises Nvidia ‘AI Factories’
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: If the product name sounds familiar, it should. It's a collab with Nvidia that combines AWS tech with the chip maker's tech.
